result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus in court for Maurice A Shegonee. State - here for PLEAS. Cveykus puts off record conversations on the record, defendant would like to pursuit Wellness Court and asking for an adjournment, Shegonee agrees. Court will allow an adjournment, will continue bond, set for PLEAS on 8/31/22 at 2:45 PM.

11:52 AM Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State - here for PH but believes it is being waived. Shegonee and Cveykus agree. Court has waiver of right to PH, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed the Information. Cveykus waives reading of Information, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for JT, clerk confirms address and phone number.

10:03 AM Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Maurice A Shegonee appeared by video means from FOSO. State filed the complaint this morning. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Shegonee understands charges and penalties, thought Attorney Cveykus would be here today. State - bond - amend bond on this matter to $1,000.00 cash and keep bond at $10,000.00 cash on 22-1679. Court so orders bonds as stated - sets this matter for AIA on 3/23/22 at 9:45 and 22-1679 tomorrow for INIT at 8:30 AM (2/16/22).

Maurice Shegonee 22-1669 and 22-1588. Called 10:12 AM. Shegonee appears by video from FC jail. Alex Seifert appears by video. CC and CR appear by video. State asks for adjournment for reasons as stated on the record. Court will allow adjournment to 2/15/22 at 9:45 AM. Shegonee has filed a written request to modify bond. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Shegonee indicates he has contacted Rick Cveykus. Confirms address 5052 Devils Lake Lane, Crandon. Court questions where he is working, employed and lives. Shegonee responds and asks for signature bond or lower cash bond. State asks for bond to remain for reasons as stated on the record. Court will continue bond as set at this point and can be addressed next week.
for a bond modification.
